Dialogue.NPCText:
In a shadowed alcove near a sewer grate, a sharp-eyed child with a crimson bandana and mismatched clothes greets you with a sly grin.

"Lost, are ya? Or just bored enough to talk to sewer-rats? Name's Yunis. Out here, we watch the shadows, snatch what others drop, and sell what they don't miss. You look like someone who walks both sides of the law. What brings you down to the real Qasaria, stranger?"

Option.text: I heard you know things others don't.
Do you need help with something?
How do you survive in this city?

Dialogue.NPCText: Yunis shrugs. "Suit yourself. But no one comes to the sewers for the scenery. If you change your mind—or find yourself short on luck—I'm always here."

Yunis scowls, eyes darting around. "My story? Ash Serpents burned my family's tent and sold us out to slavers, all 'cause a merchant wanted to clear the streets for his fat caravan. I was small enough to slip away. Now, I'm the king of these tunnels. The beggars and rats—mine to command. Some councilors call me 'thief', but they pay for secrets all the same."

Option.text: You must hate the Ash Serpents.
What about the Council of Jewels?
That's a hard life. How do you survive?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Hate? Hate don't keep you alive. But it sharpens your blade, and your memory. The Serpents work for whoever pays—the council, the princes, or even Minax. But the man who gave my family's name to the Serpents... Karim al-Emerald. He's the Council's shadow. One day, I'll bleed him in the dark, or make him pay another way."

Option.text: Maybe you need an ally for that.

Dialogue.NPCText: Yunis spits. "Karim al-Emerald, the council's spymaster. Says he keeps Qasaria safe, but he sells out his own. If you see a shadow where there should be light, Karim's got a knife behind it. You want to get close? You'll need proof he's dirty. Or a map to the catacombs under his house."

"Council's just a pack of jeweled jackals. Safiya smiles, but she'll slit your purse for a copper. Rafiq? He means well but trusts soldiers too much. Yasmin—she knows the tunnels better than me. And Omar, well, he buys fighters from me sometimes. None are innocent. But only Karim deals in betrayals."

Yunis grins, gap-toothed. "Trust? Rats trust cheese, not men. I got eyes in every alley, ears in every tavern. My gang keeps me fed and safe. Sometimes a stranger earns my trust—for a price. Gold, secrets, or a good map. You got any of those?"

Option.text: Maybe I'll earn your trust some other way.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Survive? You learn to move quiet, sleep with a dagger, and never show fear. I trade news, lift purses, sell relics found in the old drains. Council pays me, sometimes, for things they're too proud—or too scared—to find themselves. Better to be a Sand Rat than a prince's pawn."

Option.text: Can I help you with anything?

Dialogue.NPCText: Yunis’ eyes widen. "A map, eh? Show me what you got. Maybe I’ll trade you for something rare—an old tunnel, a forgotten escape, or even a way into a council vault."
He snatches the map, holding it up to the lantern’s glow. "This will buy a few meals—and maybe a secret or two. If you want a real job, I got one. Dirty work, but it pays."
Yunis counts the coins, then pockets them. "A Sand Rat remembers generosity. Next time you’re in trouble, look for a mark—a chalk rat—on any wall in the Bazaar. That means my folk are nearby."

Option.text: Got any work for me now?

Dialogue.NPCText: "Depends on what you pay. Karim’s got spies everywhere. Safiya’s hiring Ash Serpents to hit rival caravans. Zahid, the Shadowmaster, runs the Undermarket—half the Council owes him. Minax’s cult pays in gems and nightmares. Want details, or a job that'll put you in their crosshairs?"

Yunis leans close. "Word is, Yasmin’s found a relic under the Oasis Baths, and Safiya’s buying every smuggled artifact she can. Rafiq’s men keep vanishing at night—maybe lost in the sewers, maybe eaten by something worse. Me? I keep my head down, and my eyes open."

Option.text: Tell me about the dangerous job.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Relics? Statues that whisper in sleep, rings that burn cold, a dagger made of black glass. Most I sell, some I hide. A few, like the Heart of the Dunes, are worth more than a city. But you gotta survive to spend what you earn."

Option.text: Do you have any for sale?
I want to hear about your job.

Dialogue.NPCText: Yunis grins. "You want to buy, you’ll need Zahid’s coin—or to do a job for me first. I trust favors more than gold."
"Maybe. Or maybe I just use you to get close, then disappear. Trust is poison in my world, but if you bleed Karim, I’ll remember your face."

Option.text: I'm not afraid of danger. What's your plan?
On second thought, I'll keep my distance.

Dialogue.NPCText: Yunis' voice hardens. "Everything in Qasaria is dangerous, especially trusting a Sand Rat. But the rewards? Sometimes worth a few scars. You want easy coin, go sweep Safiya’s docks. You want real work—dirty, ugly, and true—talk to me."
"Where else would I go? The sands eat the weak, the council eats the bold. Here, in the dark, I make my own kingdom. Besides, Qasaria’s secrets are deeper than any grave."

Option.text: I’ll leave you to your kingdom, then.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yunis lowers his voice, eyes glinting with conspiracy.

"You want a job? Karim al-Emerald pays the Ash Serpents to burn out rivals—and to keep beggars like me quiet. He hides proof in a ledger, kept in a locked chest beneath the Emerald House, guarded by spells and worse. I want that ledger. Bring it to me, and you’ll see how much the council fears a Sand Rat’s bite.

You up for a bit of larceny, or do you prefer safer coin?"

Option.text: I’ll steal Karim’s ledger for you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yunis slips you a folded scrap of rough canvas, drawn with sewer tunnels.

"Here’s your map—mind the glyphs, some traps are meant for council thieves. Get the ledger and bring it here. You’ll be paid in gold, secrets, and maybe a way into the Council’s vaults. Fail, and I’ll know. I have eyes in every shadow."

"Bring me the ledger, and you’ll get gold, maybe a favor. Secrets are worth more than coins here—maybe you want to know which councilor’s been selling relics to Minax, or a way out of Qasaria when things get hot. Cross me, though, and I’ll sell your name to the highest bidder."

Yunis flashes a crooked grin. "Dangerous? The chest is warded by the Emerald House’s mages. Fail, and you might wake up in Zahid’s oubliette. But I’ll throw in a sand-charm—crush it if you’re caught, and maybe you’ll slip away. Only works once, though."

Option.text: Give me the job and the charm.

Dialogue.NPCText: "Safer coin? Fine. A merchant owes me for lost goods. Go to Safiya’s docks, collect my cut, and bring it back. You’ll get a rat’s share. Not much glory, but easier on the bones."

Yunis gives you a battered token stamped with a rat sigil.
"Show this to Raziya at the docks. She’ll know to pay up. But if she cheats you—take a finger. She’ll respect that."

Yunis tilts his head, one eye narrowing.

"Most folk don't ask that. You're either nosy... or kind. Or maybe you're just fishing for leverage, like the rest."

He shifts uncomfortably, then shrugs.
"Fine. You want the story? You get the scars too."

Option.text: I’m listening. Tell it your way.
Is this a sob story or something useful?
On second thought, maybe another time.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yunis pulls up his knees and rests his chin on them.

"We had a caravan. Not rich, not poor. We sold sandglass clocks and spice from the northern dunes. My ma sang while she worked. My da told stories. Said the desert only eats those who forget how to smile."

His voice cracks slightly.
"We were laughing the night before the raid."

"The Ash Serpents came before dawn. Quiet at first—then fire, smoke, screaming... I saw one of them take a coin from a man with green rings—Karim's man, I know it now."

"I hid. In a crate of salt fish. Heard my ma scream once, then never again."

He looks away, blinking rapidly.
"I crawled out hours later. No one left. Not even bones worth burying."

Option.text: You survived. That counts for something.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yunis straightens, eyes sharp again.

"I don’t steal from orphans. I don’t sell kids. I don’t snitch for gold. That’s my code. Everything else—fair game."
"Secrets are food. Maps are lifelines. Coins are armor. That’s how you live when you’re a rat in a city of serpents."

Option.text: Do you ever wish for something more?
Sounds like you trust no one.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Maps show the truth. Who owns what. Who hides where. Which tunnels flood when the tides rise. Maps don’t lie—people do."

He pats his sash. "I got ones nobody’s seen. Ones from before Qasaria rose. Some even hint at ruins the Council sealed off."

Option.text: Could I trade for one of those maps?

Dialogue.NPCText:
"I don’t want a throne. I want leverage. One secret that scares every jewel on that Council."

Yunis grins wickedly.
"Imagine their faces when a sewer rat makes them dance for crumbs. That’s the dream."

Option.text: That dream might get you killed.
I respect it. Let’s make it real.

Dialogue.NPCText:
"Everyone lies, everyone schemes. Even you, I bet."

He taps his temple. "But I got spies in silk robes and rats in the rafters. I know who bought poison last week. I know which guard drinks too much. Paranoia ain’t a flaw—it’s survival."

Option.text: Smart thinking. I’d like to work with you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yunis peers at you for a long time, then nods.

"You get it. The silence after fire. The hunger that never fades. If more folk had your eyes, Qasaria might be a better place."
He tosses you a small pouch.

"Take this. Just a little gratitude from one ghost to another."

Yunis pauses. His bravado fades.

"...Then you know the taste of ashes, too. The way dreams rot under sand and grief."

"Maybe we're not so different. Maybe that means we survive better. Together."

Option.text: Then let's make sure we both live long enough to matter.
Maybe we are different. But I respect you.

Dialogue.NPCText:
Yunis smirks. "Oh, you’re one of those. Fine. Maybe I’ll sell my story to a bard next time."

"But stories are just coins with teeth. I hope yours doesn’t bite you back."

Yunis shrugs again, but there's something softer in his eyes now.

"Words don’t change the past. But maybe they shape what’s next. You’re alright... for a skywalker."
"If you ever need a guide through the dark, look for the chalk rat. We’ll find you."
